title: Republicans react after Trump calls DeSantis 6-week abortion ban 'a terrible mistake'
description: Speaking Sunday, September 17, on NBC's 'Meet the Press,' Donald Trump repeatedly declined to say whether he would support a federal ban on abortion.

title: Hunter Biden sues US tax service after agents' disclosure to Congress
description: The son of US President Joe Biden claims that two agents from the Internal Revenue Service wrongly shared his personal information in their testimony before Congress.

title: Russia summons French ambassador citing 'Russophobic' actions
description: Moscow claimed the French organizers of a press conference in India refused access to Russian journalists and attempted to confiscate their phones.

title: US real estate on the brink of crisis
description: Sales of commercial premises are collapsing, dragging fragile operators like coworking promoter WeWork down with them. The residential sector is holding up for the time being, but the ingredients for a catastrophe seem to be in place.

title: Niger: The coveted oil windfall and its starring role in the coup
description: According to those close to President Mohamed Bazoum, rivalries over the sharing of future oil revenues were a key factor in the July 26 putsch.

title: Libya flooding: UN warns disease outbreak could be 'second devastating crisis'
description: A number of aid agencies are worried about the risk of a serious disease outbreak after sanitary conditions collapsed following the flash floods that ravaged Libya last week.

title: Paris park renamed in memory of Iranian Mahsa Amini
description: From September 16, the Villemin Garden in the 10th arrondissement of Paris will bear the name of Mahsa Jina Amini. The death of the 22-year-old a year ago after her arrest by Tehran's morality police had led to nationwide protests.

title: Thirty years after the wolf's return to France, coexistence with farmers remains a challenge
description: With an estimated population of 1,104 animals, France is still struggling to find a formula for peaceful coexistence.

title: In Italy, Marine Le Pen chooses Salvini over Meloni
description: The French far-right leader reiterated her support for her embattled ally, appearing alongside the Lega Nord leader near Bergamo on Sunday. She also promoted her idea of a 'declaration of the rights of nations and peoples' to target the EU.

title: Iran releases five Americans in prisoner swap
description: Frozen funds totalling nearly $6 billion were transferred to Qatari banks before the five US prisoners were flown out of Tehran on Monday.

title: Nicaragua, a new pathway to the US for Senegalese would-be emigrants
description: Less dangerous than the journey to Europe via the Canary Islands, this new route is generating a lot of interest in Senegal.

title: The French – and Jean Dujardin – certainly embraced the clichés for the Rugby World Cup opening ceremony. Does anyone care?
description: The opening ceremony of the Rugby World Cup at the Stade de France on September 8 unfolded with a very French style of fanfare.

title: In Lampedusa, EU's von der Leyen unveils 'a European response' to migration crisis
description: The European Commission president, accompanied by Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, presented an emergency plan on the Mediterranean island on Sunday to help Rome manage a record flow of migrants.

title: The transparent backpack aimed at preventing school shootings
description: Some products, born in the United States, are spreading around the globe. Le Monde tested the transparent backpack, designed to prevent pupils from bringing guns to school.

title: 'Fed up with the French system,' increasing numbers of French students are choosing Montréal
description: This year 3,400 French students started the new academic year at the University of Montréal, Canada's largest French-language university.

title: French interior minister to travel to Rome over migration crisis
description: Thousands of people arrived on the Italian island of Lampedusa last week, prompting European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen to travel there Sunday to announce an emergency action plan.

title: In Belgium, several schools set on fire after extremist campaign against sex education
description: The incidents have occurred at a time when the Walloon government's educational program is under attack from radical religious and conspiracy circles.

title: UNESCO adds two Ukrainian sites to World Heritage in Danger list
description: At its meeting in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, the organization classified buildings threatened by war in Kyiv and Lviv, which will allow for further financial and technical aid.

title: Was Brexit's impact on the UK's economy ultimately negligible?
description: Revised economic statistics portray the United Kingdom as experiencing weak growth, affected by the departure from the European single market, but far from collapse.

title: Taiwan detects over 100 Chinese warplanes around its island
description: China’s military sent 103 warplanes toward Taiwan in a 24-hour period in what the island’s defense ministry said Monday was the most for a day in recent times.

title: Ghanaian cocoa farmers remain trapped in poverty
description: Despite the industry's promises, farmers in the world's second-largest cocoa producer continue to suffer misery.

title: Rédoine Faid's escape trial: The embarrassing inertia of the prison administration
description: Despite several explicit warnings and a request to transfer the French gangster to a different facility to prevent any escape risks, no action was taken in the weeks leading up to his 2018 breakout from Réau prison in central France.

title: Russian exiles in Serbia face expulsion threats
description: Serbian authorities, aligned closely with Moscow, have labeled certain Russian citizens exiled in Belgrade since the onset of the war in Ukraine as potential 'national security' risks.

title: Armand Duplantis shatters pole vault world record as Gudaf Tsegay sets women's 5,000m world record
description: The Swedish star raised the bar yet again, breaking his own pole vault world record with a phenomenal leap of 6.23m at the Diamond League finals while the Ethiopian ace obliterated the women's 5,000m world record in a blistering time of 14:00.21.
